title: TTolbi Door Leg Stretcher: Stretching with Leg Flexibility Trainer, Dance Equipment: Splits Trainer Bands for Stretching in Ballet, Cheerleading, Gymnastics, Cheer Stuff, Door Stretch Strap
descriptions:
TTolbi Door Leg Stretcher

Simple tool to help you stretch your legs safely at home. It hooks over a closed door and lets you lift and gently stretch your leg while holding a soft strap. No drilling, no screws, and it will not damage your door.

What it helps with
- Looser, more flexible legs
- Better balance
- Easier movement in hips and legs

Who can use it
- Beginners and experts
- Women and men
- Teens and adults, including seniors
Note: If you have balance problems or joint pain, use a chair or wall for support. Talk to your doctor if you are unsure about stretching.

Comfort and safety
- Soft door anchor made of a resistant sponge that protects your door
- Strong cotton strap (lightweight, about 150 grams)
- Secure metal D-ring for easy length adjustment

What’s in the box
- Leg stretching strap with door anchor
- Extra resistance band for gentle exercises
- Carry bag to keep everything together
- Simple, step‑by‑step instructions

How to use (easy steps)
1) Choose a sturdy door that closes firmly. Close the door with the soft anchor on the other side so it stays in place.
2) Stand close to the door. Hold the strap and place your foot in the loop.
3) Gently raise your leg using your hands on the strap. Move slowly. You should feel a comfortable stretch, not pain.
4) Breathe and hold for 15–30 seconds. Lower your leg slowly.
5) Switch legs. Start with a few minutes and add time as you feel better.

Helpful tips
- Warm up first: march in place or walk around the room for 3–5 minutes.
- Use a chair or countertop for balance.
- Stretch slowly. Stop if you feel sharp pain, dizziness, or numbness.
- Store it in the carry bag after use.

Made for everyday use and easy to set up and put away. The TTolbi Door Leg Stretcher helps you stay flexible and steady on your feet, right in the comfort of your home.
